intro: Gutierrezia spathulata, commonly known as narrowleaf bisbee goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Gutierrezia spathulata is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
